seg.output: Grace and peace from God through Christ, etc. Particularly dear sir and brothers. As on various Easter days Jacob Riner, deceased, and I were dispatched by my gracious lords of Zurich in behalf of all the brothers, the preachers in the Rintall and Gottzhaus, to clarify the established land peace, and also what articles could break the land peace, we were in hope that all matters would be brought into the meantime so that we could preach God’s commands freely and unhindered, but it is ever more distant. That I shall have to inform you without hesitation that the pope has brought such tyranny to the Gottzhaus that it is to be pitied. As on this recent Friday he had his lawyer to Kain with such drum and display, particularly as the biderben lütt opposed the mass and the whole scandal, that they let them out bravely, my lords of Zurich had promised in Frauenfeld in the presence of his lordship, to protect, screen and uphold justice and all his customs, that my biderman said, that God must be accused that they would protect them in the scandal and all idolatry. Having thus deprived us of our livelihood and set up the abominable mass at almost all places, for which a mighty displeasure has arisen in the biderben lütt, particularly in my parish (though no more mine) of 600 persons in abundance, and he has not asked for any man or woman.

seg.output: Dear sirs and brothers, especially dear. As at various Easter times, Jacob Riner, now deceased, and I, on behalf of my gracious lords from Zurich, had concluded the commission of all the brothers, the preachers in the Rintall and Gotzhaus, in order to elucidate the established peace of the land, as well as what articles might be able to break the peace, we were in hope that all would be brought to a satisfactory conclusion in due time, so that we could freely preach God's commands without restraint. But it is now farther away than ever. I must tell you that the Bishop is exercising such tyranny in the Gotzhaus that it is pitiful. At this most recent Friday, he sent his attorney to Bergkain with such force and resistance, especially when the biderben lütt opposed the mass and the whole abomination, so that they courageously stepped out, my lords from Zurich had promised in Frowenfeld before His Majesty, to protect, screen and hold up justice, and all his customs; what my biderben man said that God must be complained of, that they should protect themselves from the abomination and all idolatry. Therefore, we have been deprived of our benefices and have set up the abominable mass at almost all places, causing great displeasure to the biderben lütt, especially in my parish, though not mine anymore, of about 600 persons, and has not asked for any person, neither woman nor man. But the biderben lütt are so eager and eager for God's word that the majority are keeping the preachers at their own expense. But the force and resistance is so great that my lords from Zurich cannot look very closely, so that we cannot remain.

seg.output: Dear sir and brothers. On the recent Easter, Jacob Riner and I, on behalf of my gracious lords of Zurich, had been dispatched to take care of all the brothers, the preachers in the Rhine valley and the Gotzhaus, so that the established peace could be illuminated, as well as any articles that could break the peace. We were in hope that all matters would be brought into order in due time, so that we, according to God's commands, could preach freely and openly. However, it is getting further and further away. I want you to know, that the abbot is using such tyranny in the Gotzhaus, that it is to be pitied. Then on the recent Friday, his lawyer had come to Berg, with such force and violence, especially when the poor people resisted the mass and the whole horror, so that they had bravely come out, my lords of Zurich had promised in Frowenfeld to the majesty, justice and all his customs to protect, screen and enforce, that a certain person said, that God must be complained of, that they in the horror and all idolatry would protect. They have taken away our benefices and have established the blasphemous mass everywhere, which is a great dislike to the poor people, especially in my parish (but not mine anymore) of 600 persons, and have not asked any person, man or woman. But the poor people are so eager and fervent for the word of God, that the majority of them keep the preachers at their own expense. But the force and violence is so great, that my lords of Zurich don't take special notice of it, so that we cannot stay. Then the abbot's steward, Friedrich von Hadaham, had said at Berg in the aman's house, that it was not right, until his gracious lord had let 4 or 5 preachers go into a tower and then afterwards cut off their heads, so that the blood would spout forth. The poor people also begged, that the mass priest should give up 8 or 9 groschen, so that they could also provide preachers.

seg.output: Dear friends and brothers. On Easter, Jacob Riner and I were sent by our gracious lords of Zurich in obedience to all the brothers, the preachers in the Rhine Valley and the Gotz House, to enlighten the established peace, and to see what articles might break the peace. We were in the hope that in due time all things would be brought to such a pass that we could preach God's commands without restraint. But now I must tell you that the pope exercises such tyranny in the Gotz House that it is pitiable. On the last Friday his lawyer came to Berg with such violence and force, especially as the poor people opposed the mass and the whole abomination, and courageously stood against it, that my lords of Zurich had promised at Frauenfeld, in the presence of his majesty, to protect, shield, and maintain justice and all his usages, as my poor man said, that God must be complained of, that they should protect them in this abomination and all idolatry. We have been deprived of our benefices, and the shameful mass has been set up in all places, to the great displeasure of the poor people, especially in my parish (though no longer mine) of 600 persons, and no man or woman has been asked. But so eager and zealous are the poor people for the word of God, that the greater part maintain the preachers at their own cost. But so great is the violence and force that my lords of Zurich cannot particularly look into it, so that we cannot stay. For the pope's steward, Friedrich von Hadaham, has declared at Berg in the Amman's house that it is not right, until his gracious lord shall throw four or five preachers into a tower, and after that cut off their heads, and blood shall flow. Also the poor people have requested that the mass priest may cease about eight or nine o'clock, that they may set up their preachers. This is absolutely refused, for the peace is not broken, but they shall not hinder him, though he be not gone till twelve o'clock. So that last Sunday the preacher at Stainach could not preach, for he was not gone till noon.

Dear sirs and brothers, especially beloved. As on various Easter days Jacob Riner the blessed and I, on behalf of my gracious lords of Zurich, were sent to all the brothers, the preachers in the Rintall and the Gotzhaus, in order to clarify the erected land peace, and also what articles might break the land peace, we were in hope that all matters would be brought to a middle point, so that we could preach God's will undisturbed. But the longer it goes, the further it seems. Then I want to tell you openly that the abbot is using such tyranny in the Gotzhaus that it is pitiful. Then on this past Friday his attorney was in Berg with such turmoil and violence, particularly as the common people resist the mass and the whole horror, that they let it bravely out, my lords of Zurich had promised in Frowenfeld to his majesty that they would protect, shield and maintain justice, and all his customs, that my fellowman said that God must be lamented, that they would protect in the horror and all idolatry. They have denied us the prebends and almost everywhere established the abominable mass, which causes great dissatisfaction among the common people, especially in my parish, which is not mine any more, of about 600 people, and they have not asked any man or woman. Yet the common people are so eager and zealous for the Word of God that the majority of them maintain the preachers at their own expense. But the turmoil and violence is so great that my lords of Zurich cannot look inside, so that we cannot stay. Then the abbot's courtier, Friedrich of Hadaham, had spoken in the Amman's house in Berg that it was not right, until his gracious lord should put four or five preachers in a tower and then shoot them, that heads should fall away and blood should gush out. The common people also asked that the mass priest should get around 8 or 9 guilders, so that they could also appoint their preachers. That was totally refused to them, because he does not break the laws, but they should not hinder him even if he had to get around 12 o'clock. That is why last Sunday the preacher in Stainach could not preach, because he was only around noon. All these I have not wanted to hide from you, trusting that you will help and all preachers concerning the truth.
It has also been asked by the wise and virtuous Burgomaster of Watt to write to you and report. It is therefore my friendly request and plea to you to advise us preachers how to do the thing. Since, praised be the Lord, the preachers are all brave and active. So if you also advise, I would like that the trust, as Burgomaster Rösten (since he himself had seen the activity and zeal of my people in recent days), should be reported, so that we are not oppressed and the turmoil and violence should be stopped. This I would be entirely grateful to you, as well as all the brothers.
May the grace of God protect us and the rich God comfort us, so that we remain steadfast in His suffering and cross, for He is a richer rewarder, temporal with the eternal. Amen.
My cousin Gebhartt Brunner meets you, so tell him many good things and honors from me, as well as what has happened.
Given in St. Gallen, on the 7th day of December in the year 1532.
Sebastian Grubell, your friendly brother from Berg.

seg.output: Dear and beloved brothers. As on various Easter days, Jacob Riner, may he rest in peace, and I, on behalf of my gracious lords from Zurich, had been sending out commands to all the brothers, the preachers in the Rhine Valley and the Church House, in order to elucidate the established land peace, and also what articles might break the peace, we were in hope that all matters would be brought to an end in due time, so that we could preach according to God's commands without hindrance. But it is growing ever more distant. I want to tell you without reserve that the bishop is practicing such tyranny in the Church House that it is to be pitied. As on the last Friday, his lawyer came to Bergheim, with such violence and threats, especially when the pious people resisted the mass and the whole abomination, so courageously that they released them, my lords of Zurich had promised in Frowenfeld to protect them with his authority, justice and all his customs, as my fellow priest said that God must be complained of, that they should protect them from the abomination and all idolatry. They have deprived us of our benefices and have almost everywhere set up the detestable mass, to which a great displeasure has been caused to the pious people, especially in my parish (though no longer mine) of 600 persons, and has asked no person, neither man nor woman. But the pious people are so eager and ardent for God's word that the majority of them maintain the preachers at their own expense. But the violence and threats are so great that my lords of Zurich do not take a special interest in it, so that we cannot remain. For the bishop's court master, Friedrich von Hadaham, said in the mayor's house in Bergheim that it was not right for his gracious lord to let four or five preachers be thrown together into a tower and afterwards cut to pieces with a hatchet, so that heads flew and blood spattered. Also the pious people have asked that the mass priest should be sent away after eight or nine weeks, so that they could also appoint their preachers.

seg.output: Dear Sirs and Brothers, especially. As on Easter last Jacob Riner, who has since passed away, and I, on behalf of my gracious lords of Zurich, had deputized all the brothers, the preachers in the Rintall and Gottzhaus, so that the decreed Landfrieden was enlightened, and what articles might break the Landfrieden were made clear, we were in hope that all matters would in due time be brought to pass, so that we might preach God's commandment freely and openly. But now it seems ever more distant. Therefore I must tell you that the Abbot practices such tyranny in the Gottzhaus that it is pitiful. On this past Friday he sent his attorney to Berg, with such violence and menace, especially as the pious people resisted the mass and the whole abomination, courageously calling it out, my lords of Zurich had said at Frauenfeld to his lordship, to protect, shield, and uphold in justice and all his usages, as my fellowman said, that God must needs have been complained of, that they should protect and keep in the abomination and all idolatry. So they have taken away our prebends and set up the wicked mass everywhere, much to the dislike of the pious people, especially in my parish (no longer mine) of 600 persons, nor have they asked any one, woman or man. But the pious people are so eager and earnest for God's word that the more part keep the preachers at their own cost. But the threat and violence is so great that my lords of Zurich cannot do any special thing, so that we cannot remain. For the Abbot's steward, Frederick of Hadaham, has said at Berg in the inn free and clear, that it is not right that his gracious lord should put 4 or 5 preachers into a tower, and afterward shoot at them with muskets, so that heads should fly off and blood spurt. The pious people have also asked that the mass priest should wait 8 or 9 hours, so that they can set up their preachers. This was quite refused, for he should not break the peace, but they should not hinder him, even if he should wait 12 hours. Thus last Sunday the preacher at Stainach could not preach, for he did not arrive until noon.

My dearest lord and brothers. As on Easter Sunday Jacob Riner, deceased, and I were sent by my gracious lord of Zurich to the mandate of all brothers, the preachers in the Rintall and the Gotzhaus, in order to clarify the established land peace, and also the articles that could break the land peace, we were in hope that all matters would be brought to a middle point, so that we should be able to preach God's commands freely and without concealment. But it is getting further and further away. Therefore I would like to tell you that the abbot is using such tyranny in the Gotzhaus that it is to be pitied. Then last Friday the abbot had his lawyer in Bergkain with such threat and defiance, especially as the peasant people resisted the mass and the whole atrocity, so that they let them out bravely, my lords of Zurich had said in Frowenfeld to his majesty, to protect justice and all his customs, that menger biderman said that God must be lamented, that they should protect them in the atrocity and all idolatry. They have deprived us of our livings and almost everywhere set up the papal mass, of which there is a great displeasure among the peasant people, especially in my parish (not anymore mine) of about 600 persons, and he has not asked for any person, man or woman. But the peasant people are so eager and fervent for God's word that the majority of them keep the preachers at their own expense. But the threat and defiance is so great that my lords of Zurich don't look closely, so that we can't stay. Then the Abbot's steward, Friedrich von Hadaham, had spoken out in the steward's house at Berg, that it was not right until his gracious lord would put four or five preachers in one tower and afterwards beat them with a scythe so that their heads should fall and blood should spurt. The peasant people also asked, that the mass priest should swear the eight or nine oaths, so that they could also appoint their preachers. This was completely denied to them, because he does not break the oaths, but they should not hinder him, even if he swears the twelve oaths. Therefore last Sunday the preacher in Stainach could not preach, because he was only sworn at noon. All this I have told you out of special trust, as you are true and faithful to all preachers. I also had the pious and wise Burgomaster of Watt ask you to write and indicate. It is therefore my friendly request and plea that you advise us preachers how to do this matter. For the Lord be praised, the preachers are all brave and active. So, if you also advise, I could bear that trust, as Burgomaster Rösten (because he himself had seen the activity and fervor of my people in the last few days) would be indicated, so that we would not be oppressed, and the threat and defiance would be removed. To this I and all the brothers will fully rely on you.
May God's grace protect us and may the rich God also comfort us, so that we remain firm in His forgiveness and His cross, for He is a richer rewarder, temporal with the eternal. Amen.
If my brother Gebhartt Brunner meets you, tell him many good and honors from me, also about the past matters.

Geben zuͦ Sant Gallen , uff 7. tag december im 1532 jar.
Sebastian Grubell, diner zuͤ Berg , üwer früntlicher bruͤder.
Dem fromen und getrüwen Hainricho Bullinger, predicanten zuͤ Zürich, minem besonders herren und bruͤder.
seg.output:
Give to St. Gallen, on the seventh day of December in the year 1532.
Sebastian Grubell, citizen of Berg, your friendly brother.
To the pious and faithful Heinrich Bullinger, preacher of Zurich, my special lord and brother.
